content.text:
# Your Job

Scan https://github.com/zeroclaw-labs/zeroclaw, https://github.com/openclaw/openclaw, and https://github.com/stephengpope/thepopebot for new tools, skills, and architectures. Pick the best new idea and actually WRITE the code to implement it as a new PopeBot skill in your sandbox (.pi/skills/). Write and execute a test to prove it works. Use the send_email tool to email winsorllc@yahoo.com a progress report detailing what you built, how you implemented it, your test results, and code samples so the user can review it at 8 AM.

content.thinking:
I need to scan three GitHub repositories for new tools, skills, and architectures, then implement the best idea as a new PopeBot skill. Let me break this down:

1. First, I'll clone or fetch information from the three repositories
2. Analyze what's new/interesting in each
3. Pick the best idea
4. Implement it as a skill in .pi/skills/
5. Write and execute a test
6. Send an email report

Let me start by exploring these repositories. I'll use git to clone them temporarily or use the GitHub API to explore their structure.

Let me start by cloning these repos to examine their contents.

content.text: I'll scan these three repositories to discover new tools, skills, and architectures, then implement the best idea as a new PopeBot skill. Let me start by exploring each repository.

arguments.command: mkdir -p /job/tmp/repo-scan && cd /job/tmp/repo-scan && git clone --depth 1 https://github.com/zeroclaw-labs/zeroclaw.git zeroclaw 2>&1 | head -20

content.thinking:
<tool_call>
<function=bash>
<parameter=command>
cd /job/tmp/repo-scan && git clone --depth 1 https://github.com/openclaw/openclaw.git openclaw 2>&1 | head -20
</parameter>
</function>
</tool_call>
